_header: Glorious Edmund king of East England
Subjects: Edmund, saint, prayer to; prayers, to saints
_description: John Lydgate, A prayer to St. Edmund — twelve 8-line stanzas

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Glorious Edmund kyng of Estyng londcallid of marteris charboncle
                    and Ruby…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…aue rex gentis shal ech day be ther songcallyng to þe
                    for helpe in ther most neede
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: HEre begynneth a praier to seynt Edmund (f. 19)
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 124-7.

CULKk16.First Lines:
glosious Edmunde Kyng of EstyngelondeCalde of martyris Charboncle
                    & Rubie…
CULKk16.Last Lines:
…Aue rex gentis schall ech day be ther songeCallynge to the
                    for helpe in þer mooste neede
CULKk16.Attributed Title:
Here…begyneth an holy preyer to Seynt Edmund Kyng Martyr and Mayden
                    (f. 202); Here enduth þis holy preyere of Seynt Edmunde the whych dan John
                    Lydgate made (f. 203v)

BLHar2255.First Lines:
Our helpe our socour our mediatour moost cheefAs thou art kyng and
                    Prince of this Cuntre…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…And rex gentis shall ech day be ther songCallyng to the for
                    helpe in ther most nede
